data.title: External Condition whitelist crashes.
data.body:
So, I am using Grant external condition to stack levels of a condition on actors, when they reach the max level possible by the condition, something fancy happens (kudos because this wasn't possible with the upgrade system), in this case your guys will be able to fire a final projectile that has the change onwer warhead.

The issue here is that the External Conditions trait crashes if I don't give every single condition a clear use, like what you can see here for example, I am forced to use the level conditions for dummy multipliers, if I remove a single range multiplier, then the game will crash after the first BoardingPod projectile reaches it's target.

The exception is below the template code.

```
^Boardable:
	TemporaryOwnerManager:
	StackedCondition@Boarding:
		Condition: Boarded
		StackedConditions: Boarded2, Boarded3, Boarded4, Boarded5, Boarded6
	ExternalConditions@Boarded:
		Conditions: Boarded, Boarded2, Boarded3, Boarded4, Boarded5, Boarded6
	RangeMultiplier@Boarded:
		RequiresCondition: Boarded
		Modifier: 100
	RangeMultiplier@Boarded2:
		RequiresCondition: Boarded2
		Modifier: 100
	RangeMultiplier@Boarded3:
		RequiresCondition: Boarded3
		Modifier: 100
	RangeMultiplier@Boarded4:
		RequiresCondition: Boarded4
		Modifier: 100
	RangeMultiplier@Boarded5:
		RequiresCondition: Boarded5
		Modifier: 100
	RangeMultiplier@Boarded6:
		RequiresCondition: Boarded6
		Modifier: 100
	Targetable@Boardable:
		TargetTypes: Boardable
		RequiresCondition: Boarded6

BoardingPodDebuff:
	Inherits: BoardingPod
	InvalidTargets: Boardable
	ValidTargets: CapitalShip, Frigate, Corvette, Ground, Air, AirHit
	Warhead@1Dam: SpreadDamage
		InvalidTargets: Boardable
		ValidTargets: CapitalShip, Frigate, Corvette, Ground, Air, AirHit
	-Warhead@4OwnerChange: ChangeOwner
	Warhead@Boarded: GrantExternalCondition
		Range: 350
		Duration: 350
		Condition: Boarded
		InvalidTargets: Boardable
		ValidTargets: CapitalShip, Frigate, Corvette, Ground, Air, AirHit
		AffectsParent: True
		ValidStances: Enemy, Neutral
```

data.title: D2K - Remove the unused "TargetTypes: Air" from ornithopter
data.body:
Looks like someone forgot it when removing `Targetable:` trait from it.

In original game Ornithopter is targetable, but as our ornistrike sytem isn't same as original, i think it is good to keep them untargetable for now.

data.title: D2K - Make AI able to use Fremen SW.
data.body:
Values are Random, as this SW is not really a SW to fire at somewhere, i think, any positive value of `Attractiveness:` under `Consideration:` would make the AI fire the SW.

AI uses the Actors that are crated in their Attack Groups as normal.

I didn't add one for Saboteurs, because AI doesn't know how to use them.

data.title: Fix yaml merging (again).
data.body:
Node removal was previously only run on the first level children unless they require additional merging.  This propagates it further down the tree.

Fixes #12362.
Fixes #12519.

data.title: Add OS bitness to sysinfo query

data.title: Smarter warhead/projectile victim scans
data.body:
Instead of a fixed `TargetExtraSearchRadius` that is added unconditionally, all affected warheads and projectiles now look up the rules for the largest health shape, and add exactly that value by default (the old, static behaviour can still be enforced by setting a custom override value).

This way, modders don't have to find and set an optimal value themselves.

As an example how much this can help performance during heated battles, launch the RA mod, build 50 flamethrowers and make them shoot at the exact same time, on bleed and on this branch. The lag spike on the performance graph should be nearly 3 times as high on bleed vs. this PR, because the projectile is `Blockable` and the largest outer health radius in RA is only `543 WDist` (compared to the old default overscan of `1536`).

Closes #12574.

data.body: I'm pretty sure crates can spawn on spice, concrete or transition tiles in original game.

data.body: Used to make TS Orca Bomber bombs behave more like in the original.

data.title: Introduce TargetDamageWarhead + some TS weapon fixes
data.body:
This PR makes more TS weapons use inheritance where sensible/applicable and additionally fixes a few more minor issues I noticed while making the changes.

The commits do contain a few changes on top of merely using inheritance, but unlike in previous PRs, this time I learned my lesson and listed all intentional changes in the respective commit messages.

Closes #12636.

data.title: Make "Infiltrates:", "Captures:" and "Demolition:" tags upgradable.
data.body:
I actually need `Infiltrates:` to be upgradable, but those tags are related and neither are Upgradable, so i think if one can be made upgradable, all can be.

I'm trying to make Spies built from a seperate structure which is available at start (like kennel) and get infiltartion ability only if player has Radar Dome for my modmaps.

data.title: Fix spicebloom spawns on all older D2k maps
data.body:
Follow-up to #12584.

Spice blooms are not supposed to show and grow on cells occupied by spice, which is the case for pretty much all pre-placed spice blooms.

data.title: [Build Error]'SDL' didn't include the define of 'SDL_GetDisplayDPI'
data.body: When I download the recent code from repository and build OpenRA, the compiler noticed : 'SDL' didn't include the define of 'SDL_GetDisplayDPI'

data.title: Rename existing activity states
data.body: Split off from #12461.

data.title: Add support for switching to mods from other engine installations.
data.body:
This implements the first and most difficult step towards #2585, #11813, and #12554, but does not change or remove any existing behaviour.  Mods write a metadata file to `^/ModMetadata/<id>-<version>.yaml` which are loaded to populate a new `Game.ExternalMods` data structure.

If a mod is not listed in `Game.Mods` but is listed in `Game.ExternalMods` then the player is shown a confirmation prompt to close the current version of OpenRA and launch the engine used by the external mod:

![screen shot 2017-01-20 at 21 01 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/22165906/25a29f8e-df56-11e6-8042-971262f832a7.png)

This includes a test commit that disables the internal mod switching so that this can be tested without duplicating/hacking the openra directories.  Mods must be launched at least once before they become available for external switching.

The OSX launcher changes are living for now in [OpenRALauncherOSX/launcher-exec](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRALauncherOSX/tree/launcher-exec). I haven't pushed an updated bundle and referenced that in the packaging scripts here because ~~(a) that would make this pr depend on #12501 and (b)~~ the general idea of `Engine.LaunchPath` should be reviewed before anything is officially pushed to any repo.

data.title: Reduce ongoing allocations
data.body:
Avoid some common allocation in the main game loop, and also tidy up some code as a side-effect. Hopefully fairly straightforward.

These save 9.7% in the amount of memory allocated when running the RA shellmap.

data.title: D2K - Fix Low Repair and Terrain Damage.
data.body:
Fixes #12570.

I think 8x works fine, but need your opinions. Doing calculations was not a good way as there are 2x to 10x amounts of HPs for structures when compared to RA.

data.title: Large map names wont show up entirely in the lobby screen.
data.body:
As the title say,having a large name for a map is like looking in the night sky for venus with a naked eye.
Larger map names are getting often out of screen,and the user can only see the half part of the sentence.
probably 2 options can be used as a solution first make the letters smaller as the sentence gets bigger and 
make this "\n" work too in the game lobby.Any other ideas?

data.title: Capture the flag game mechanics.
data.body:
for a game like this the only idea that comes to mind is attaching a shp to a shp,and be able to "pick" up a shp. For example,a unit enter the same cell with the flag,then the unit picks up the flag until it enters his own flag cell,then it "drops" the flag and the enemy flag is returned to its previous position.
Like ordinary c.t.f. games in fps.
and like koty have its own GUI elements like scoring for victory,max number of captures set by the author of the map.

it can be like this:

E1:
carryflag: true
drobflagondeath: true

ctf:
ctfmax: 6

something like that.
